Posts.Content: Stlfingerpaints wrote: Hi, I have read many of your brave stories and posts, and know that there have been many questions on the topic of breast dimpling. Here is my situation and would love any feedback that can be offered. In January I noticed some dimpling on the underside of my right breast. At the time I didn't realize it could be a symptom of BC until I started to research it. I went to the OB in February and I was referred to have a diagnostic mammo and they did an ultrasound which found nothing and I left with peace of mind. I noticed it getting more noticeable and after reading a lot your posts, found that many had been missed on the ultrasound and mammos. I called the dr again who referred me back to the breast center. My appointment was yesterday. The physician didn't feel anything and didn't notice the dimpling so much till I showed her a picture. The breast surgeon came in and again didn't feel anything and told me that it is caused from "having birthdays and babies". I asked why it would just suddenly show up now and why would it be getting more noticeable, and again she said basically from getting older. I'm 38 with 3 kids by the way. She did an ultrasound and again it didn't show anything. She said insurance companies don't like to cover 2nd mammograms in less than 6 months and said that without having good reason insurance companies also won't cover an MRI. She said because of the dimpling I'll have to come back in 3 months to have it monitored. I don't really know what else I can do. In your opinion is it ok to wait 3 months? I also have some pain in only that nipple and occasional sharp pains in only that breast.Thanks in advance Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast dimpling Stlfingerpaints Stlfingerpaints
